column4: good evening everyone, anyone here strong in wine, and being good with netbook remix is a plus too =p
it's usually a good idea to just ask your question
ah right okay
then if someone can help you they will

well I'm in the status of completely elimitating windows, and I'm trying to get warcraft 3 working, I've installed through wine, but it crashes upon opening the game itself, and I get a black screen during the intro
if you didn't do it yet, you should check this: http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=version&iId=1177
thanks, that actually helped some =D I got into the game, but it's extremely laggy... could it be graphics driver issues?
could be. Depends on your drivers too. Try disabling compiz if you are using it...
I read somewhere that ubuntu has a native driver for the GMA 950 mobile graphics chip, is this true, or will I need to install a new graphics driver?
Intel has free graphics included in the installation.
!ask | Consulta
ah right.. okay so it is not a driver issue then I can gather
it could be a driver issue. You most likely need nonfree drivers.
unless you have Intel.
my lspci lists a intel 945GM/GMS as VGA
then I don't know where the problem could be.
you've been a great help so far, I got in to the game, so thank you for that =D I'm still reading the page for some fixes etc, maybe something else there fixes my problem

if you can't fix the problem leave a comment in that page and maybe someone else can tell you what's going on. I rarely use WINE and I never played any games with it, so unfortunately that's as much as I can help you.
I don't plan on doing much gaming either, but I'm surprised how well it handles windows applications, I'm thinking about trying office
I heard Crossover Office works perfectly, but it's not free as in beer.
Crossover Office is pretty much a WINE modified to work seamless with MS Office
